page.title: List of airports in Saint Martin

revision.text:
[[File:Saint-Martin Island map-en.svg|thumb|right|350px|Map of Saint Martin/Sint Maarten with location of airports]] This is a '''list of [[airport]]s in [[Saint Martin]]''', an [[island]] in the northeast [[Caribbean]]. The southern [[Netherlands|Dutch]] half of the island comprises the ''[[Sint Maarten]]'' and is a [[Countries of the Kingdom of the Netherlands|constituent country]]. This portion contains the island's international airport: [[Princess Juliana International Airport]]. The northern [[France|French]] half of the island comprises the ''[[Collectivity of Saint Martin|Collectivité de Saint-Martin]]'' (Collectivity of Saint Martin), which became an [[overseas collectivity]] (''collectivité d'outre-mer'' or ''COM'') of [[France]] on February 22, 2007. Previously it was a French [[commune in France|''commune'']] of [[Guadeloupe]], which is an [[overseas region]] (''région d'outre-mer'') and [[overseas department]] (''département d'outre-mer'' or ''DOM'') of France. It contains the island's smaller airport which offers flights to the other islands of the [[French West Indies]]: Guadeloupe, [[Martinique]] and [[Saint Barthélemy]]. __NOTOC__ {{clear}} ==Airports== {| class="wikitable" |- valign=baseline ! style="text-align:left;" | Location served ! style="text-align:left;" | [[ICAO airport code|ICAO]] ! style="text-align:left;" | [[IATA airport code|IATA]] ! style="text-align:left;" | Airport name ! style="text-align:left;" | [[Geographic coordinate system|Coordinates]] |- valign=top | [[Philipsburg, Sint Maarten]] | TNCM {{WAD|TNCM}} | SXM {{GCM|SXM}}, {{ASN|SXM}} | '''[[Princess Juliana International Airport]]''' [http://www.st-martin.org/us/my_trip/how_to_come.php St-Martin.org (official tourism website) - Airports] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071025215254/http://www.st-martin.org/us/my_trip/how_to_come.php |date=2007-10-25 }} | {{coord|18|02|27|N|063|06|32|W|region:AN_type:airport|name=Princess Juliana Airport (Sint Maarten)}} |- valign=top | [[Grand Case]], [[Collectivity of Saint Martin|Saint Martin]] | {{AIP_FR|TFFG|CAR-SAM-NAM}} {{WAD|TFFG}} | SFG {{GCM|CCE}}, {{ASN|CCE}} | '''[[L'Espérance Airport]]''' | {{coord|18|06|02|N|063|02|56|W|region:MF_type:airport|name=L'Espérance Airport (Saint Martin)}} |} == See also == {{GeoGroupTemplate}} * [[List of airports in France]] * [[List of airports in the Netherlands Antilles]] * [[List of airports by ICAO code: T#Saint Martin]] * [[List of airports by ICAO code: T#Netherlands Antilles]] * [[Wikipedia: Airline destination lists: North America#Saint Martin (France)]] * [[Wikipedia: Airline destination lists: North America#Netherlands Antilles]] ==References== ;French civil aviation sites: *{{en icon}} [http://www.sia.aviation-civile.gouv.fr/default_uk.htm Aeronautical Information Service / ''Service d'information aéronautique'' (SIA)] **{{en icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20081124220819/http://www.sia.aviation-civile.gouv.fr/html/frameset_aip_uk.htm Aeronautical Information Publications (AIP)] ===Footnotes=== {{reflist}}
{{Caribbean topic|List of airports in}} {{North America topic|List of airports in}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Airports in Saint Martin}} [[Category:Lists of airports by country|Saint Martin]] [[Category:Airports in the Collectivity of Saint Martin| ]] [[Category:Airports in Sint Maarten| ]] [[Category:Collectivity of Saint Martin-related lists]] [[Category:Lists of airports in the Caribbean|Saint Martin]]

[[Menorca]] is a small island in the [[Mediterranean Sea]] belonging to [[Spain]], with a population of approximately 88,000. It is located 39°47' to 40°00'N, 3°52' to 4°24'E. There is good data on the butterflies of Menorca<ref>Cello, J., 1980. Els Rhopalocera de les Illes Balears. ''Treb. Soc. Cat. Lep.'', 3:51-60</ref><ref>Cello, J., 1980. Els Rhopalocera de les Illes Balears. Cens provisional. ''Treb. Soc. Cat. Lep.'', 4:33-53</ref><ref>Pons, G., 2000. ''Les papallones diurnes de les balears.'', 87pp. Edicions Documenta Balear, Palma de Mallorca.</ref><ref>Carreras, J., Jubany, J., and Stefanescu, C. 2004 Noves cites de papallones diürnes per a Menorca i les Illes Balears (Lepidoptera: Rhopalocera) ''Butll. Soc. Cat. Lep., 93.'' http://www.obsam.cat/documents/articles/Noves-cites-papallones-diurnes-Menorca-Balears.pdf</ref> although it is not easy to find as most field guides do not give data on the smaller Mediterranean islands. A good source in English is Butterflies of Menorca<ref>[http://turismenatural.obsam.cat/en/papallones/papallones-de-menorca/ Butterflies of Menorca]</ref> which lists 26 species and gives data on flight period and abundance.
Butterflies can be seen in all months of the year but the best months are May to September, the only butterfly not to fly in this period is the green hairstreak which usually flies from February to April, but if the season is late it can be seen into May.
==[[Papilionidae]]== [[Image:Swallowtail menorca.jpg|thumb|left|Swallowtail, Menorca]] '''Swallowtails''' * ''[[Papilio machaon]]'', swallowtail
==[[Pieridae]]== [[Image:Cleopatra butterfly menorca.jpg|thumb|left|Cleopatra, Algendar gorge, Menorca]] '''Whites''' * ''[[Colias crocea]]'', clouded yellow * ''[[Gonepteryx cleopatra]]'', Cleopatra (common) * ''[[Gonepteryx rhamni]]'', brimstone (rare; very few good records - Brimstones on Menorca maybe scarce migrants from the Spanish mainland but in the field it is hard to tell apart from the very common Cleopatra so it is probably under reported.) * ''[[Leptidea sinapis]]'', wood white (uncommon woodland species) * ''[[Pieris brassicae]]'', large white * ''[[Pieris rapae]]'', small white * ''[[Pieris napi]]'', green-veined white * ''[[Pontia daplidice]]'', Bath white
==[[Nymphalidae]]==
=== [[Satyrinae]] === [[Image:Speckled wood menorca.jpg|thumb|left|Speckled wood ''aegeria'' sub-species, Algendar gorge, Menorca]] '''Browns''' * ''[[Coenonympha pamphilus]]'', small heath * ''[[Maniola jurtina]]'', meadow brown (abundant) * ''[[Pararge aegeria]]'', speckled wood (abundant - The speckled wood found on Menorca is the ''aegeria'' sub-species which has an orange background colour.) * ''[[Lasiommata megera]]'', wall (subspecies ''paramegera'' occurs as well as the nominate form.<ref>Tolman. T. & Lewington. R., 2008. ''Collins Butterfly Guide''. Pub. Collins p 320</ref>) * ''[[Lasiommata maera]]'', large wall (very rare probably extinct) * ''[[Hipparchia semele]]'', grayling (very rare probably extinct) * ''[[Hipparchia statilinus]]'', tree grayling (very rare probably extinct) * ''[[Pyronia cecilia]]'', southern gatekeeper (common)
===[[Danainae]]=== '''Monarchs''' * ''[[Danaus chrysippus]]'', plain tiger (The plain tiger is a migrant that is sometimes seen on Menorca.)
===[[Nymphalinae]]=== * ''[[Vanessa atalanta]]'', red admiral * ''[[Vanessa cardui]]'', painted lady * ''[[Charaxes jasius]]'', two-tailed pasha (uncommon woodland species)
==[[Lycaenidae]]== [[Image:Small copper menorca.jpg|thumb|left|Small copper, Binigaus, Menorca]] '''Blues''' * ''[[Polyommatus icarus]]'', common blue (abundant, seen all over the island) * ''[[Polyommatus bellargus]]'', Adonis blue (uncommon) * ''[[Aricia cramera]]'', southern brown argus (fairly common - May be confused with female common blue.) * ''[[Celastrina argiolus]]'', holly blue (common) * ''[[Lampides boeticus]]'', long-tailed blue (local) * ''[[Leptotes pirithous]]'', Lang's short-tailed blue (local) * ''[[Lycaena phlaeas]]'', small copper (local)
[[Image:G bronze.JPG|thumb|left|Geranium bronze sitting on a geranium leaf, Cala Alcaufa, Menorca]]
* ''[[Callophrys rubi]]'', green hairstreak (flies very early; February to April) * ''[[Cacyreus marshalli]]'', geranium bronze (can be seen year round - The geranium bronze is not a native to Menorca. In 1990 it was introduced, accidentally, to [[Majorca]] on imported ''[[Pelargonium]]'' from South Africa. The butterflies quickly spread to Menorca and other islands as well as to southern Spain and Italy. They are often seen in gardens on geranium plants.)
==See also== *[[List of dragonflies of Menorca]]
==References== <references/>
==External links== * http://turismenatural.obsam.cat/en/papallones/ * [http://perso.orange.es/meul_12345/indspain.htm Systematic list of species of Butterflies of Spain] * http://www.obsam.cat/documents/comunicacions/Aportacions-ropalocers.pdf * [https://www.flickr.com/groups/1806764@N23/pool/with/6810947657/ Images of the wildlife of Menorca] * [http://www.descobreixmenorca.com/en/butterflies-of-menorca/ Butterflies of Menorca. Discovering Menorca]
[[Category:Fauna of the Balearic Islands]] [[Category:Environment of Menorca]] [[Category:Butterflies of Europe|*Menorca]] [[Category:Balearic Islands-related lists|Butterflies, Menorca]]

page.title: List of diplomatic missions of Afghanistan

revision.text:
{{Dynamic list}}
This list is of '''heritage registers''', inventories of [[Cultural property|cultural properties]], natural and man-made, tangible and [[Intangible cultural heritage|intangible]], movable and immovable, that are deemed to be of sufficient [[Values (heritage)|heritage value]] to be separately identified and recorded. In many instances the pages linked below have as their primary focus the registered assets rather than the registers themselves. Where a particular article or set of articles on a [[List of Wikipedias|foreign-language Wikipedia]] provides fuller coverage, a link is provided. {{TOC right}}
==Global== *{{flag|United Nations}} **[[World Heritage Site]]s (see [[Lists of World Heritage Sites]]) – [[UNESCO]], advised by the [[International Council on Monuments and Sites]] **[[Globally Important Agricultural Heritage Systems]] (GIAHS) – [[Food and Agriculture Organization]]
==Albania== {{flag|Albania}}: [[List of Religious Cultural Monuments of Albania]] *[[National Centre of Cultural Property Inventory (Albania)|National Centre of Cultural Property Inventory]]
==Andorra== {{flag|Andorra}}: [[Bé d'interès cultural]], as maintained by [[Patrimoni Cultural]] = [[Cultural Heritage of Andorra]]; {{ca icon}} [[:ca:Llista de monuments d'Andorra|Llista de monuments d'Andorra]]
==Argentina== {{flag|Argentina}}: [[List of National Historic Monuments of Argentina|National Historic Monuments of Argentina]]; {{fr icon}} [[:fr:Monument historique national (Argentine)|Monument historique national (Argentine)]]
==Australia== {{flag|Australia}}: [[:Category:Heritage registers in Australia|Heritage registers in Australia]] ;Federal registers *[[Australian National Heritage List]] *[[Commonwealth National Heritage List]] *[[List of Overseas Places of Historic Significance to Australia|Overseas places of historic significance to Australia‎]] *''[[Register of the National Estate]]'' (defunct register)
;State and territory registers *[[New South Wales State Heritage Register]] *[[Northern Territory Heritage Register]] *[[Queensland Heritage Register]] *[[South Australian Heritage Register]] *[[Tasmanian Heritage Register‎]] *[[Victorian Heritage Register]] *[[State Register of Heritage Places|Western Australia State Register of Heritage Places]]
== Austria == {{flag|Austria}}: [[Denkmalgeschütztes Objekt]], as maintained by the [[Bundesdenkmalamt]]
==Belarus== {{flag|Belarus}}: [[Cultural Properties of Belarus]]
== Belgium == {{flag|Belgium}}: [[National Heritage Site (Belgium)]]; {{nl icon}} [[:nl:Categorie:Lijsten van cultureel erfgoed|Lijsten van cultureel erfgoed]]
==Bosnia and Herzegovina== {{flag|Bosnia}}: [[List of National Monuments of Bosnia and Herzegovina]], as maintained by the [[Commission to preserve national monuments of Bosnia and Herzegovina]];<ref>[http://kons.gov.ba/ Commission to preserve national monuments] {{webarchive|url=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20150426200503/http://kons.gov.ba |date=2015-04-26 }} [[Commission to preserve national monuments of Bosnia and Herzegovina]]. Retrieved on 2012-03-27. {{bs icon}} & {{en icon}}.</ref>
==Brazil== {{flag|Brazil}}: [[List of National Historic Heritage of Brazil]], as maintained by the [[National Institute of Historic and Artistic Heritage]];<ref>[http://portal.iphan.gov.br/portal/baixaFcdAnexo.do?id=1356 List of National Historic Heritage of Brazil] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131020222618/http://portal.iphan.gov.br/portal/baixaFcdAnexo.do?id=1356 |date=2013-10-20 }} [[National Institute of Historic and Artistic Heritage]]. Retrieved on 2012-03-27. {{pt icon}}.</ref> {{pt icon}} [[:pt:Categoria:Listas de patrimônio do Brasil|Listas de patrimônio do Brasil]]
==Burma== {{flag|Burma}}: [[Yangon City Heritage List]]<ref name=mt>{{cite journal|url=http://www.myanmar.gov.mm/myanmartimes/no87/New/14.htm |title=Yangon Heritage List |publisher=The Myanmar Times |date=2001-10-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090615164607/http://www.myanmar.gov.mm/myanmartimes/no87/New/14.htm |archivedate=2009-06-15 |df= }}</ref>
==Canada== *{{flag|Canada}} The [[Canadian Register of Historic Places]], while it confers no historic designation or protection itself, endeavours to list all federal, provincial, territorial and local sites.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.historicplaces.ca/acc-hom.aspx|title=HistoricPlaces.ca - Recherche|website=www.historicplaces.ca|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924030402/http://www.historicplaces.ca/acc-hom.aspx|archivedate=24 September 2015|df=}}</ref>
;Federal *[[List of national historic sites of Canada|National Historic Sites of Canada]]
;Provincial *{{flag|Alberta}} **Sites owned and run by the provincial government as a functioning historic site or museum are known as [[Provincial historic sites of Alberta|Provincial Historic Sites]] and Provincial Historic Areas. Buildings and sites owned by private citizens and companies or other levels or branches of government may gain one of two levels of historic designation, "Registered Historic Resource" or "Provincial Historic Resource".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://culture.alberta.ca/heritage/resourcemanagement/historicplacesstewardship/designation/default.aspx|title=Header and Footer|first=Government of|last=Alberta|website=culture.alberta.ca|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20110710080423/http://culture.alberta.ca/heritage/resourcemanagement/historicplacesstewardship/designation/default.aspx|archivedate=10 July 2011|df=}}</ref> Historic designation in Alberta is governed by the Historic Resources Act.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.qp.gov.ab.ca/Documents/acts/H09.CFM|title=Alberta Queen's Printer:|first=Government of|last=Alberta|date=28 December 2006|website=www.qp.gov.ab.ca|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080705214431/http://www.qp.gov.ab.ca/Documents/acts/H09.CFM|archivedate=5 July 2008|df=}}</ref> The province also lists buildings deemed historically significant by municipal governments on the Alberta Register of Historic Places, which is also part of the larger Canadian Register of Historic Places although this does not imply provincial or federal government status or protection.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://culture.alberta.ca/heritage/resourcemanagement/historicplacesstewardship/designation/municipal.aspx|title=Alberta Culture and Community Spirit – Historic Resources Management – Historic Places Stewardship Section – Alberta's Historic Places Designation Program – Municipal Historic Resource Designation<!-- Bot generated title -->|publisher=|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101205022849/http://culture.alberta.ca/heritage/resourcemanagement/historicplacesstewardship/designation/municipal.aspx|archivedate=5 December 2010|df=}}</ref> The Alberta Main Street Program helps to preserve historic buildings in the downtowns of smaller communities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.albertamainstreet.org/|title=The Alberta Main Street Program<!-- Bot generated title -->|publisher=|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110623100324/http://albertamainstreet.org/|archivedate=23 June 2011|df=}}</ref> The Heritage Survey Program is a survey of 80,000 historic buildings in Alberta, with no protective status.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://culture.alberta.ca/heritage/resourcemanagement/historicplacesstewardship/heritagesurveyprogram.aspx|title=Alberta Culture and Community Spirit – Historic Resources Management – Historic Places Stewardship Section – Heritage Survey Program<!-- Bot generated title -->|publisher=|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706164327/http://culture.alberta.ca/heritage/resourcemanagement/historicplacesstewardship/heritagesurveyprogram.aspx|archivedate=6 July 2011|df=}}</ref> *{{flag|New Brunswick}} **Places and areas designated under the [[Heritage Conservation Act (New Brunswick)|Heritage Conservation Act]] (the New Brunswick Register of Historic Places acts as a register of sites designated under the Act)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.historicplaces.gnb.ca|title=Historic Places - Tourism, Heritage and Culture|first=Government of New Brunswick,|last=Canada|website=www.historicplaces.gnb.ca|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171012062836/http://www.historicplaces.gnb.ca/|archivedate=12 October 2017|df=}}</ref> *{{flag|Newfoundland}} **[[Heritage Foundation of Newfoundland and Labrador]] designated properties *{{flag|Ontario}} **Properties designated under the [[Ontario Heritage Act]] *{{flag|Quebec}} **[[Répertoire du patrimoine culturel du Québec]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.patrimoine-culturel.gouv.qc.ca/ |title=Répertoire du patrimoine culturel du Québec |publisher=Patrimoine-culturel.gouv.qc.ca |date=2013-05-09 |accessdate=2014-03-28 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060207034012/http://www.patrimoine-culturel.gouv.qc.ca/ |archivedate=2006-02-07 |df= }}</ref>
;Local *[[List of heritage buildings in Vancouver|Heritage buildings of Vancouver]] *[[City of Toronto Heritage Property Inventory]] * Register of Historic Resources in Edmonton<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.edmonton.ca/portal/server.pt/gateway/PTARGS_0_0_284_220_0_43/http%3B/CMSServer/COEWeb/infrastructure+planning+and+building/Historic+Resources/Municipal+Historic+Resources+and+Register+of+Historic+Resources+in+Edmonton.htm|title=City of Edmonton<!-- Bot generated title -->|publisher=|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061110015634/http://www.edmonton.ca/portal/server.pt/gateway/PTARGS_0_0_284_220_0_43/http%3B/CMSServer/COEWeb/infrastructure+planning+and+building/Historic+Resources/Municipal+Historic+Resources+and+Register+of+Historic+Resources+in+Edmonton.htm|archivedate=10 November 2006|df=}}</ref>
==Chile== {{flag|Chile}}: [[National Monuments of Chile]], as maintained by the Consejo de Monumentos Nacionales<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.monumentos.cl/|title=CMN. Consejo de Monumentos Nacionales. Gobierno de Chile|website=www.monumentos.cl|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170614135857/http://www.monumentos.cl/|archivedate=14 June 2017|df=}}</ref>
==China== {{flag|China}}: [[Major Historical and Cultural Site Protected at the National Level]] (全国重点文物保护单位), designated by [[State Administration of Cultural Heritage]]
;Hangzhou [[Major Site to Be Protected for Its Historical and Cultural Value at the National Level#Sites Protected at various levels|Sites Protected at the City Level]] of [[Hangzhou]] are districts, artifacts or buildings legally declared to be "protected". According to the "Regularations of historic districts and historic buildings in Hangzhou" effectivated from 1 January 2005, historic buildings are those artifacts or districts that have lasted more than 50 years, and of significant values for history, science, and art study. In Hangzhou, declaring a historic house requires consulting the urban planning administration bureau, and the real estate administration bureau.
As of 31 June 2011, there are 287 declared historic houses in Hangzhou, proclaimed as 5 batches.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hangzhoumemory.org/|title=优优国际网站_99uu优优国际_澳门优优赌场_www.优优99uu.com|website=www.hangzhoumemory.org|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170626210140/http://www.hangzhoumemory.org/|archivedate=26 June 2017|df=}}</ref> In the near future, it is going to issue the sixth batch which includes 51 historic houses. *[[List of first batch of declared historic buildings in Hangzhou]] *[[List of second batch of declared historic buildings in Hangzhou]] *[[List of third batch of declared historic buildings in Hangzhou]] *[[List of fourth batch of declared historic buildings in Hangzhou]] *[[List of fifth batch of declared historic buildings in Hangzhou]]
;Harbin *'''Harbin Urban and Rural Planning Bureau''' **[https://web.archive.org/web/20110707052015/http://www.upp.cn/english/view/Arts/index_1.html Preserved Buildings]
;Hong Kong *[[Declared monuments of Hong Kong]] *[[List of Grade I historic buildings in Hong Kong]] *[[List of Grade II historic buildings in Hong Kong]] *[[List of Grade III historic buildings in Hong Kong]]
==Colombia== {{flag|Colombia}}: [[National Monuments of Colombia]]; {{es icon}} [[:es:Anexo:Monumentos Nacionales de Colombia|Monumentos Nacionales de Colombia]]
== Croatia == *{{flag|Croatia}} [[Register of Protected Natural Values of the Republic of Croatia]] *[[Register of Cultural Goods of the Republic of Croatia]]
==Cuba== *{{flag|Cuba}} [[Consejo Nacional de Patrimonio Cultural]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cnpc.cult.cu/|title=Portal del Consejo Nacional de Patrimonio Cultural|website=www.cnpc.cult.cu|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170614210411/http://www.cnpc.cult.cu/|archivedate=14 June 2017|df=}}</ref>
==Czech Republic== *{{flag|Czech}}: {{cz icon}} [[:cz:Seznam národních kulturních památek České republiky|Seznam národních kulturních památek České republiky]], {{de icon}} [[:de:Liste der Nationalen Kulturdenkmale Tschechiens|Liste der Nationalen Kulturdenkmale Tschechiens]], as featuring on MonumNet<ref>{{cite web |url=http://monumnet.npu.cz/chruzemi/hledani.php |title=MonumNet |publisher=Národní památkový ústav (National Heritage Institute) |accessdate=5 May 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120530052238/http://monumnet.npu.cz/chruzemi/hledani.php |archivedate=30 May 2012 |df= }}</ref>
==Denmark== *{{flag|Denmark}}: National Register of Sites and Monuments, as maintained by the [[Danish Agency for Culture]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kulturarv.dk/english/sites-and-monuments/register/ |title=Register |publisher=Heritage Agency of Denmark |accessdate=5 May 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120223122758/http://www.kulturarv.dk/english/sites-and-monuments/register/ |archivedate=23 February 2012 |df= }}</ref>
==Estonia== *{{flag|Estonia}}: [[National Registry of Cultural Monuments]].<ref>[http://register.muinas.ee/public.php National registry of Cultural Monuments] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141101235553/http://register.muinas.ee/public.php |date=2014-11-01 }} Muinsuskaitseamet</ref> It is maintained by the [[National Heritage Board of Estonia]]. It has been described as one of the most successful and more complete heritage registers.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://csanet.org/newsletter/spring14/nls1403.html |title=Website Review: National Register of Cultural Monuments (of Estonia) |author=Andrea Vianello |publisher=CSA Newsletter (Vol. XXVII, No. 1 — April, 2014) |accessdate=3 March 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20150305081032/http://csanet.org/newsletter/spring14/nls1403.html |archivedate=5 March 2015 |df= }}</ref>
*{{flag|Estonia}}: [[Estonian inventory of intangible cultural heritage]]. It is maintained by the [[Estonian Folk Culture Centre]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rahvakultuur.ee/Estonian_inventory_of_intangible_c_2428 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2018-04-24 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180425114731/http://www.rahvakultuur.ee/Estonian_inventory_of_intangible_c_2428 |archivedate=2018-04-25 |df= }}</ref>
==France== *{{flag|France}} [[Monument historique]] **[[Mérimée List]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.culture.gouv.fr/documentation/merimee/accueil.htm|title=La base Mérimée sur le patrimoine architectural français|website=www.culture.gouv.fr|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20110217161019/http://www.culture.gouv.fr/documentation/merimee/accueil.htm|archivedate=17 February 2011|df=}}</ref> **[[List of historic monuments of 1840]]. See [[:fr:Liste des monuments historiques de 1840|Liste des monuments historiques de 1840, at Fr. Wikipedia]] * [[List of World Heritage Sites in France]]
==Germany== *{{flag|Germany}}: The [[Deutsche Stiftung Denkmalschutz]] is an organization which facilitates public awareness and protection of heritage sites listed. These lists are kept on the website [http://www.denkmalliste.org/ denkmalliste.org], which has all German heritage registers ("Denkmallisten") gathered together in one portal.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.denkmalliste.org |title=Startseite |publisher=denkmalliste.org |date= |accessdate=2014-03-28 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140326095712/http://www.denkmalliste.org/ |archivedate=2014-03-26 |df= }}</ref> *[[Kulturdenkmal]] **[[Bayerische Denkmalliste]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.blfd.bayern.de/blfd/region.php?menu=top&source=17862|title=BlfD<!-- Bot generated title -->|publisher=|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070518085345/http://www.blfd.bayern.de/blfd/region.php?menu=top&source=17862|archivedate=18 May 2007|df=}}</ref>
==Hungary== *{{flag|Hungary}}:The [[:hu:Forster Gyula Nemzeti Örökségvédelmi és Vagyongazdálkodási Központ|Forster Gyula Nemzeti Örökségvédelmi és Vagyongazdálkodási Központ]] was an organization which facilitates public awareness and protection of heritage sites listed up to 2016.12.31. ([http://www.koh.hu/muemlekvedelem/muemlekek/678#3 There] are partial list from 8 county of Hungary). From 2017.01.01. the cultural heritage management is in the competence the [http://www.kormany.hu/en/prime-minister-s-office Prime Minister’s Office] and the [http://www.mma.hu/en/web/en Hungarian Academy of Arts]. *[http://www.muemlekem.hu/muemlek Műemlékem] is a non official list maintained by a non-governmental organization.
==Indonesia== {{flag|Indonesia}}: [[Cultural Properties of Indonesia]]
==India== * {{flag|India}}: [[National Archives of India]] * {{flag|India}}: [[List of World Heritage Sites in India]] * {{flag|India}}: [[List of Monuments of National Importance in India]]
==Ireland== {{flag|Ireland}}: In the [[Republic of Ireland]], some registers are maintained by sections of the [[Department of Arts, Heritage and the Gaeltacht]] (The National Monuments Service and [[National Inventory of Architectural Heritage]]). Others are maintained by the "planning authority": the [[local government in the Republic of Ireland|local council]] for the [[counties of Ireland|county]], [[List of cities, boroughs and towns in Ireland|city, borough, or town]] where the monument or building is sited.
{|class="wikitable" |- !Name !Type !Maintenance |- |[[National Monument (Ireland)|National Monument]] |"a monument or the remains of a monument the preservation of which is a matter of national importance by reason of the historical, architectural, traditional, artistic, or archaeological interest attaching thereto"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/plweb-cgi/fastweb?TemplateName=hitlist.tmpl&view=ag-view&query_rule=%28%28%24query3%29%29%3Alegtitle&operator=and&numresults=25&sorting=none&query3=%22NATIONAL%20MONUMENTS%22&dbname=Acts&simplesearch.x=3&simplesearch.y=11|title=National Monuments Acts, 1930–2004|accessdate=19 December 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110605234019/http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/plweb-cgi/fastweb?TemplateName=hitlist.tmpl&view=ag-view&query_rule=(($query3)):legtitle&operator=and&numresults=25&sorting=none&query3=%22NATIONAL%20MONUMENTS%22&dbname=Acts&simplesearch.x=3&simplesearch.y=11|archivedate=5 June 2011|df=}}</ref> |Owned or managed by the National Monuments Service. The Service's own list of monuments is not definitive.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.archaeology.ie/en/NationalMonuments/SearchByCounty/ |title=National Monuments > Search By County |publisher=National Monuments Service |accessdate=19 December 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100220110315/http://www.archaeology.ie/en/NationalMonuments/SearchByCounty/ |archivedate=20 February 2010 |df= }}</ref> |- |National Inventory of Architectural Heritage |"all—<br>(a) structures and buildings together with their settings and attendant grounds, fixtures and fittings,<br>(b) groups of such structures and buildings, and<br>(c) sites,<br>which are of architectural, historical, archaeological, artistic, cultural, scientific, social or technical interest"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/1999/en/act/pub/0019/print.html|title=Architectural Heritage (National Inventory) and Historic Monuments (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act, 1999|accessdate=19 December 2009|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110605234025/http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/1999/en/act/pub/0019/print.html|archivedate=5 June 2011|df=}}</ref> |National Inventory of Architectural Heritage. The NIAH's survey is not yet complete.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.buildingsofireland.ie/Surveys/Buildings/|title=Buildings: County Survey Index|work=National Inventory of Architectural Heritage|accessdate=19 December 2009|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212233246/http://www.buildingsofireland.ie/Surveys/Buildings/|archivedate=12 February 2010|df=}}</ref> |- |protected structure |"structures, or parts of structures, which form part of the architectural heritage and which are of special architectural, historical, archaeological, artistic, cultural, scientific, social or technical interest"<ref name="pda2000">{{cite web |url=http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/2000/en/act/pub/0030/index.html |title=Planning and Development Act, 2000 |work=Irish Statute Book |publisher=Office of the Attorney General |accessdate=19 December 2009 |location=Ireland |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091027080455/http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/2000/en/act/pub/0030/index.html |archivedate=27 October 2009 |df= }}</ref> | Relevant planning authority maintains a list as part of its development plan.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.citizensinformation.ie/categories/housing/building-or-altering-a-home/protected-structures |title=Protected structures |date=29 August 2008 |work=Building or altering a home |publisher=Citizens Information Board |accessdate=19 December 2009 |location=Ireland |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090722111615/http://www.citizensinformation.ie/categories/housing/building-or-altering-a-home/protected-structures |archivedate=22 July 2009 |df= }}</ref> |- |architectural conservation area |"a place, area, group of structures or townscape, taking account of building lines and heights, that—<br>(a) is of special architectural, historical, archaeological, artistic, cultural, scientific, social or technical interest or value, or<br>(b) contributes to the appreciation of protected structures"<ref name="pda2000"/> |Planning authority |- |special planning control area |"an architectural conservation area [...] of special importance to, or as respects, the civic life or the architectural, historical, cultural or social character of a city or town in which it is situated"<ref name="pda2000"/> |Planning authority |- |area of special amenity |"by reason of—<br>(a) its outstanding natural beauty, or<br>(b) its special recreational value,<br>and having regard to any benefits for nature conservation"<ref name="pda2000"/> |Planning authority |- |Database of Historic Gardens and Designed Landscapes |Gardens marked on the first- or second-edition (1850–95) maps of the [[Ordnance Survey of Ireland]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.buildingsofireland.ie/Surveys/Gardens/Projectmethodology/ |title=Project methodology |work=Database of Historic Gardens and Designed Landscapes |publisher=National Inventory of Architectural Heritage |accessdate=19 December 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100313170041/http://www.buildingsofireland.ie/Surveys/Gardens/Projectmethodology/ |archivedate=13 March 2010 |df= }}</ref> |National Inventory of Architectural Heritage<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.buildingsofireland.ie/Surveys/Gardens/gardensapp/FrontPage.jsp|title=Gardens: Search by County|work=Database of Historic Gardens and Designed Landscapes|publisher=National Inventory of Architectural Heritage|accessdate=19 December 2009|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100312101146/http://www.buildingsofireland.ie/Surveys/Gardens/gardensapp/FrontPage.jsp|archivedate=12 March 2010|df=}}</ref> |}
==Italy== *{{flag|Italy}}: ''Catalogo Generale dei Beni Culturali''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.catalogo.beniculturali.it/sigecSSU_FE/Home.action?timestamp=1436451305274|title=Catalogo Generale dei Beni Culturali|website=catalogo.beniculturali.it|language=it|accessdate=14 September 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160921200841/http://www.catalogo.beniculturali.it/sigecSSU_FE/Home.action?timestamp=1436451305274|archivedate=21 September 2016|df=}}</ref> under creation; ''catalogo regionale dei beni culturali'' already maintained by each region: ** {{flag|Emilia-Romagna}}: ''WebGIS del patrimonio culturale dell'Emilia Romagna''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.patrimonioculturale-er.it/webgis/|title=WebGIS|website=patrimonioculturale-er.it|language=it|accessdate=14 September 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160919192043/http://www.patrimonioculturale-er.it/webgis/|archivedate=19 September 2016|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emiliaromagna.beniculturali.it/index.php?it/311/il-webgis|title=Il WebGIS|website=emiliaromagna.beniculturali.it|language=it|accessdate=14 September 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324173001/http://emiliaromagna.beniculturali.it/index.php?it%2F311%2Fil-webgis|archivedate=24 March 2017|df=}}</ref> ** {{flag|Lombardy}}: ''Sistema Informativo dei Beni Culturali della Regione Lombardia'' (SIRBeC)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lombardiabeniculturali.it/sirbec/|title=SIRBeC|website=lombardiabeniculturali.it|language=it|accessdate=14 September 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160912170838/http://www.lombardiabeniculturali.it/sirbec/|archivedate=12 September 2016|df=}}</ref>
==Jamaica== *{{flag|Jamaica}} [[Jamaica National Heritage Trust]], established in 1958.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jnht.com/|title=Jamaica National Heritage Trust|website=www.jnht.com|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170627013753/http://www.jnht.com/|archivedate=27 June 2017|df=}}</ref> The organisation maintains a [[list of National Heritage Sites in Jamaica]].<ref name="Sites">{{cite web|url=http://www.jnht.com/monuments.php|title=Jamaica National Heritage Trust – List of Declared Sites & Monuments|year=2005|accessdate=2009-09-04|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070623072648/http://www.jnht.com/monuments.php|archivedate=2007-06-23|df=}}</ref>
==Japan== {{flag|Japan}}: [[Cultural Properties of Japan]], as maintained by the [[Agency for Cultural Affairs]]; see also [[National Treasures of Japan]]
==Korea (North)== {{flag|North Korea}}: [[National Treasures of North Korea]], [[Cultural assets of North Korea]]
==Korea (South)== {{flag|South Korea}}: [[National Treasures of South Korea]], [[Important Intangible Cultural Properties of Korea]], as maintained by [[Cultural Heritage Administration of Korea|Cultural Heritage Administration]]
==Latvia== *{{flag|Latvia}} * "The list of state protected monuments of culture", available at [http://mantojums.lv/lv/piemineklu-saraksts/]. Contains information about 7131 monuments of culture (March 2012). The list is maintained by State Inspection for Heritage Inspection, a Government agency.
==Luxembourg== *{{flag|Luxembourg}} * "Buildings and objects classified as national monuments or listed on supplementary inventory".
The list is maintained by [[Service des sites et monuments nationaux]], a Government agency. The latest version is available here [http://www.ssmn.public.lu/publications/Liste_actualis___des_objets_class__s.pdf].
See [[:lb:Lëscht vun de klasséierte Monumenter|Lëscht vun de klasséierte Monumenter]] on [[:lb:|lb-wiki]] and [[:commons:Category:Cultural heritage monuments in Luxembourg]]
==Macedonia (Republic of)== {{flag|Macedonia}}: {{fr icon}} [[:fr:Patrimoine culturel de la République de Macédoine|Patrimoine culturel de la République de Macédoine]]
==Malta== {{flag|Malta}}: [[National Inventory of the Cultural Property of the Maltese Islands]]<ref name=sagona2015>{{cite book|last1=Sagona|first1=Claudia|title=The Archaeology of Malta|date=2015|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=9781107006690|page=307|url=https://books.google.com.mt/books?id=qR5TCgAAQBAJ&pg=PA307&dq=false}}</ref>
==Mexico== {{flag|Mexico}}: [[National Monuments of Mexico]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.monumentoshistoricos.inah.gob.mx/index.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-07-13 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150713222756/http://www.monumentoshistoricos.inah.gob.mx/index.php |archivedate=2015-07-13 |df= }}</ref>
==Morocco== {{flag|Morocco}}: [[Historic Monuments and Sites of Morocco]]
==Mozambique== {{flag|Mozambique}}: [[Cultural Properties of Mozambique]]
==Namibia== {{flag|Namibia}}: National Monuments, as maintained by the [[National Heritage Council of Namibia]];<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nhc-nam.org/ |title=Homepage |publisher=[[National Heritage Council of Namibia]] |accessdate=5 May 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121025002009/http://www.nhc-nam.org/ |archivedate=25 October 2012 |df= }}</ref> {{de icon}} [[:de:Liste der Nationalen Denkmäler in Namibia|Liste der Nationalen Denkmäler in Namibia]]
==Netherlands== * {{flag|Netherlands}} [[List of Rijksmonuments]] (''[[Rijksmonument|Monumentenregister]] van de Rijksdienst voor het cultureel erfgoed'')<ref>[http://monumentenregister.cultureelerfgoed.nl/php/main.php Monument database] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110122071900/http://monumentenregister.cultureelerfgoed.nl/php/main.php |date=2011-01-22 }} of the Monumentenregister</ref>
==New Zealand== *{{flag|New Zealand}} [[Rarangi Taonga]]:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.historic.org.nz/Register/about_the_register.html|title=Heritage New Zealand|website=www.historic.org.nz|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090804080107/http://historic.org.nz/Register/about_the_register.html|archivedate=4 August 2009|df=}}</ref> The Register of Historic Places, Historic Areas, Wahi Tapu and Wahi Tapu Areas (administered by [[New Zealand Historic Places Trust]].)
==Pakistan== *{{flag|Pakistan}} There are several organizations that take care of historic and heritage sites in [[Pakistan]]. # Department of Archaeology and Museums ([[Ministry of Heritage and National Integration (Pakistan)]]) #[[National Archives of Pakistan]] #Directorate of Archaeology & Museums, Sindh ##Sindh Building Control Authority # Directorate General of Archaeology, Punjab # Directorate of Archaeology & Museums, of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. # Directorate General of Archaeology, Balochistan # [[Cultural heritage in Pakistan|List of cultural heritage sites in Pakistan]]
==Paraguay== {{flag|Paraguay}}: ''El Inventario Nacional de Bienes Culturales'', under creation by the Dirección de Catalogación del Patrimonio Cultural<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cultura.gov.py/lang/es-es/patrimonio-culturaltekopy-tee/page/2/ |title=Patrimonio Cultural |publisher=Secretaría Nacional de Cultura |accessdate=8 May 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160315031140/http://www.cultura.gov.py/lang/es-es/patrimonio-culturaltekopy-tee/page/2/ |archivedate=15 March 2016 |df= }}</ref>
==Philippines== {{flag|Philippines}}: [[Lists of Cultural Properties of the Philippines|Cultural Properties of the Philippines]]
==Poland== {{flag|Poland}}: A list of [[objects of cultural heritage in Poland]] (''zabytki'') is maintained by the [[National Heritage Board of Poland]]. It is primarily composed of objects in the [[register of objects of cultural heritage]] (''rejestr zabytków''), objects with the status of [[Historical Monument (Poland)|Historical Monument]] (''pomnik historii''), objects classified as a [[cultural park]] (''park kulturowy'').<ref name=dzu> {{Cite Polish law | title = Ustawa z dnia 23 lipca 2003 r. o ochronie zabytków i opiece nad zabytkami | trans_title = | gazette = | year = 2003 | volume = 162 | number = 1568 | date = }}</ref>
==Portugal== {{flag|Portugal}}: [[Monuments of Portugal|National Monuments]], as maintained by [[IGESPAR]]; {{pt icon}} [[:pt:Anexo:Lista de património edificado em Portugal|Lista de património edificado em Portugal]]
==Romania== * {{flag|Romania}} [[National Register of Historic Monuments in Romania]] – The list, created in 2004–2005, contains historical monuments entered in the [[National Cultural Heritage of Romania]]. It is maintained by the [[Romanian National Institute of Historical Monuments]], part of the [[Ministry of Culture and National Patrimony (Romania)|Ministry of Culture and National Patrimony]] in [[Romania]].
==Russia== {{flag|Russia}}: [[Russian cultural heritage register]]; {{ru icon}} [[:ru:Категория:Списки объектов культурного наследия России|Списки объектов культурного наследия России]]; [[Historical city of Russia|Historical Cities of Russia]]
==Senegal== {{flag|Senegal}}: Sites et Monuments historiques;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.culture.gouv.sn/article.php3?id_article=335 |title=Portant publication de la liste des Sites et Monuments historiques classés |publisher=Ministry of Culture |accessdate=6 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081208183115/http://www.culture.gouv.sn/article.php3?id_article=335 |archivedate=8 December 2008 |df= }}</ref> {{fr icon}} [[:fr:Liste des monuments et sites historiques au Sénégal|Liste des monuments et sites historiques au Sénégal]]
==Serbia== * {{flag|Serbia}}
[[Cultural Heritage of Serbia]] (see also: [[World Heritage Sites in Serbia]])
The register is divided into twelve categories: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Exceptional Importance !! Great Importance !! Protected |- | [[Archaeological Sites of Exceptional Importance (Serbia)|Archaeological Sites of Exceptional Importance]] || [[Archaeological Sites of Great Importance (Serbia)|Archaeological Sites of Great Importance]] || [[Protected Archaeological Sites (Serbia)|Protected Archaeological Sites]] |- | [[Monuments of Culture of Exceptional Importance (Serbia)|Monuments of Culture of Exceptional Importance]] || [[Monuments of Culture of Great Importance (Serbia)|Monuments of Culture of Great Importance]] || [[Protected Monuments of Culture (Serbia)|Protected Monuments of Culture]] |- | [[Historic Landmarks of Exceptional Importance (Serbia)|Historic Landmarks of Exceptional Importance]] || [[Historic Landmarks of Great Importance (Serbia)|Historic Landmarks of Great Importance]] || [[Protected Historic Landmarks (Serbia)|Protected Historic Landmarks]] |- | [[Spatial Cultural-Historical Units of Exceptional Importance (Serbia)|Spatial Cultural-Historical Units of Exceptional Importance]] || [[Spatial Cultural-Historical Units of Great Importance (Serbia)|Spatial Cultural-Historical Units of Great Importance]] || [[Protected Spatial Cultural-Historical Units (Serbia)|Protected Spatial Cultural-Historical Units]] |}
==Sierra Leone== {{flag|Sierra Leone}}: [[National Monuments of Sierra Leone]], as maintained by the Ancient Monuments and Relics Commission<ref>{{cite web |url=http://unesdoc.unesco.org/images/0003/000304/030492eo.pdf |title=Cultural Policy in Sierra Leone |publisher=[[UNESCO]] |accessdate=5 May 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140730030936/http://unesdoc.unesco.org/images/0003/000304/030492eo.pdf |archivedate=30 July 2014 |df= }}</ref>
==Singapore== *{{flag|Singapore}} [[National Monuments of Singapore]]
==Slovakia== {{flag|Slovakia}}: [[Cultural Heritage Monuments of Slovakia]]; {{de icon}} [[:de:Kategorie:Liste (Kulturdenkmale in der Slowakei)|Liste (Kulturdenkmale in der Slowakei)]]
==South Africa== *{{flag|South Africa}} [[South African Heritage Resources Agency]] *[[List of heritage sites in South Africa]]
==Spain== *{{flag|Spain}} [[Monument (Spain)]] (''Monumento histórico'' or ''[[Bien de Interés Cultural]]'') ** [[Lists of Bienes de Interés Cultural]]
==Swaziland== *{{flag|Swaziland}}: [[National Monuments of Swaziland]], as maintained by the [[Swaziland National Trust Commission]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sntc.org.sz/cultural/monuments.asp |title=Cultural Resources: National Monuments |publisher=[[Swaziland National Trust Commission]] |accessdate=5 May 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120602220340/http://www.sntc.org.sz/cultural/monuments.asp |archivedate=2 June 2012 |df= }}</ref>
==Sweden== *{{flag|Sweden}}: [[Listed buildings in Sweden]], as maintained by the [[Swedish National Heritage Board]]; see also {{sv icon}} [[:sv:Kulturmärkning i Sverige|Kulturmärkning i Sverige]]
==Switzerland== *{{flag|Switzerland}} [[Swiss Inventory of Cultural Property]] ({{lang-de|Schweizerisches Inventar der Kulturgüter}}, {{lang-fr|Inventaire suisse des biens culturels}}). National register of some 8,300 objects of international, national, regional and local significance. Managed by the [[Federal Office for Civil Protection]] (see its [https://web.archive.org/web/20140228023910/http://www.bevoelkerungsschutz.admin.ch/internet/bs/en/home/themen/kgs.html website]). *There are also [[Cantons of Switzerland|cantonal]] registers of cultural heritage sites. *See also [[:Category:Heritage registers in Switzerland]].
==Turkey== *{{flag|Turkey}} [[Immovable Cultural and Natural Properties]] ({{lang-tr|Korunması Gerekli Taşınmaz Kültür ve Tabiat Varlıkları}} (see [http://teftis.kulturturizm.gov.tr/TR,14437/korunmasi-gerekli-tasinmaz-kultur-ve-tabiat-varliklarin-.html])
==Ukraine== *{{flag|Ukraine}} [[State Register of Immovable Monuments of Ukraine]]
==United Kingdom== {{flag|United Kingdom}} {{main article|Listed building|Scheduled monument}} Heritage, culture, planning and conservation are [[devolved]] issues in the United Kingdom, and are dealt with by the governments of the constituent countries. [[England]], which does not have its own devolved government, is covered by an agency of the [[United Kingdom government]].
See also [[Historic Environment Record]] (HERs) and [[Sites and Monuments Record]] (SMRs) maintained usually at a local government level (archaeological trusts in Wales).
* [[Scheduled monument|The Schedule of Ancient Monuments]] (follows on pre-devolution 1979 Act of Parliament) *[[England]]: [[English Heritage]], an [[executive agency]] of the [[Department for Culture, Media & Sport]] ** The [[National Heritage List for England]] (launched May 2011). Contains list of all scheduled monuments, listed buildings, registered parks and gardens, historic wrecks and registered historic battlefields in England<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.english-heritage.org.uk/professional/protection/process/national-heritage-list-for-england/ |title=The National Heritage List for England |publisher=English Heritage |date= |accessdate=2014-03-28 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140327143255/http://www.english-heritage.org.uk/professional/protection/process/national-heritage-list-for-england/ |archivedate=2014-03-27 |df= }}</ref> **[[English Heritage Archive]]: formerly the National Monuments Record (England) **[[Register of Parks and Gardens]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.english-heritage.org.uk/server/show/nav.1410|title=- English Heritage|website=www.english-heritage.org.uk|accessdate=28 June 2017}}</ref> ** [[Registered Battlefields (UK)]] ** [[Protection of Wrecks Act 1973]] ** [[Heritage at Risk]] *[[Northern Ireland]]: [[Northern Ireland Environment Agency]], an [[Northern Ireland Executive agencies|executive agency]] within the [[Department of the Environment (Northern Ireland)|Department of the Environment]] *[[Scotland]]: **[[Historic Environment Scotland]], an [[Scottish Executive agencies|executive agency]] of the [[Scottish Executive Education Department]] ***[[Inventory of Historic Battlefields in Scotland|Inventory of Historic Battlefields]] ***[[Inventory of Gardens and Designed Landscapes in Scotland]] **[[Royal Commission on the Ancient and Historical Monuments of Scotland]] (RCAHMS) – executive non-departmental public body ***[[National Monuments Record of Scotland]] (NMRS): the archive formerly known as the Scottish National Buildings Record ***[[CANMORE]]: a database that is part of the NMRS *[[Wales]]: **[[Cadw]], an agency of the [[Welsh Assembly Government]] ***[[Lists of scheduled monuments in Wales|Scheduled monuments in Wales]] ***[[Cadw/ICOMOS Register of Parks and Gardens of Special Historic Interest in Wales]] **[[Royal Commission on the Ancient and Historical Monuments of Wales]], a [[Welsh Government sponsored bodies|Welsh Government sponsored body]] ***National Monuments Record of Wales (NMRW) ***''Coflein'': the online database for the NMRW
==United States== {{Expand list|date=July 2012}} In the United States, a site is only listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]] on recommendation from the [[state historic preservation office]]s in the relevant [[U.S. states|state]]. Some states maintain their own state-level historic registers, although in some U.S. states all properties on the state register duplicate the National Register listing. The National Register listing in itself confers no protection to a historic property but may qualify the site for matching grants for historic restoration. Local historic designations in many municipalities provide some limited protection against demolition of historic landmarks.
;National *{{flag|United States}} [[National Monument (United States)|National Monuments]] are a separate register from the [[National Register of Historic Places]]<ref>[http://www.cr.nps.gov/nr/travel/ National Register of Historic Places, National Park Service<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060330111430/http://www.cr.nps.gov/nr/travel/ |date=2006-03-30 }}</ref> *[[National Historic Landmark]]s<ref>[http://www.cr.nps.gov/nhl/ National Historic Landmarks Program (NHL) Homepage<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070609130328/http://www.cr.nps.gov/nhl/ |date=2007-06-09 }}</ref> *[[National Natural Landmark]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nature.nps.gov/nnl/|title=NPS: Nature & Science » National Natural Landmarks<!-- Bot generated title -->|publisher=|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080921204743/http://www.nature.nps.gov/nnl/|archivedate=21 September 2008|df=}}</ref>
;State-level and local-level {{see also|State historic preservation office}} *{{flag|Alabama}} **[[Alabama Register of Landmarks and Heritage]] *{{flag|California}} **[[California Historical Landmark]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ohp.parks.ca.gov/default.asp?page_id=21381|title=HTTP404|first=California State Parks, State of|last=California|website=CA State Parks|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111010032241/http://ohp.parks.ca.gov/default.asp?page_id=21381|archivedate=10 October 2011|df=}}</ref> **[[California Register of Historical Resources]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ohp.parks.ca.gov/default.asp?page_id=21238|title=California Register of Historical Resources|first=California State Parks, State of|last=California|website=CA State Parks|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110930111711/http://ohp.parks.ca.gov/default.asp?page_id=21238|archivedate=30 September 2011|df=}}</ref> **[[California Point of Historical Interest|California Points of Historical Interest]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ohp.parks.ca.gov/default.asp?page_id=21750|title=California Points of Historical Interest|first=California State Parks, State of|last=California|website=CA State Parks|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110930111741/http://ohp.parks.ca.gov/default.asp?page_id=21750|archivedate=30 September 2011|df=}}</ref> **[[List of Berkeley Landmarks, Structures of Merit, and Historic Districts]] **[[Los Angeles Historic-Cultural Monument]]s **[[San Francisco Designated Landmark]]s *{{flag|Georgia (U.S. state)}} **[[List of historic buildings and districts designated by the City of Atlanta]] *{{flag|Illinois}} **[[List of Chicago Landmarks|Chicago Landmarks]] *{{flag|Michigan}} **[[Michigan State Historic Preservation Office|Michigan Historic Sites]] *{{flag|Mississippi}} **[[Mississippi Landmark]]s *{{flag|New York}} **[[List of Town of Oyster Bay Landmarks|Town of Oyster Bay Landmarks]] **[[Lists of New York City Landmarks|New York City Landmarks]] (designated by the [[New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission]]) *{{flag|Pennsylvania}} **[[Philadelphia Register of Historic Places]] **[[List of City of Pittsburgh historic designations]] *{{flag|Virginia}} **[[Virginia Historic Landmark|Virginia Historic Landmarks Register]] *{{flag|Washington}} **[[Washington State Heritage Register]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dahp.wa.gov/pages/HistoricSites/Register.htm|title=Washington State DAHP<!-- Bot generated title -->|publisher=|accessdate=28 June 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070222183147/http://www.dahp.wa.gov/pages/HistoricSites/Register.htm|archivedate=22 February 2007|df=}}</ref>
==Venezuela== {{flag|Venezuela}}: ''Inventario de monumentos'', as maintained by the Instituto de Patrimonio Cultural<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ipc.gob.ve/ipc/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=47:centro-de-documentacion&catid=60:centro-de-documentacion |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120803111734/http://www.ipc.gob.ve/ipc/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=47:centro-de-documentacion&catid=60:centro-de-documentacion |dead-url=yes |archive-date=3 August 2012 |title=Centro de Documentación |publisher=Instituto de Patrimonio Cultural |accessdate=7 May 2012 }}</ref>
==Zambia== {{flag|Zambia}}: [[Monuments and Historic Sites of Zambia]]
==Zimbabwe== {{flag|Zimbabwe}}: [[National Monuments of Zimbabwe]]

page.title: List of non-native birds of Great Britain

revision.text:
The list of '''British birds''' comprises all those [[bird]] species which have occurred in a wild state in [[Great Britain]]. Since the [[Victorian era]] many bird species have been introduced to Britain, whether for sport, ornament or general experimenting, and some have established themselves whilst others have not. Others have escaped from captivity and established themselves, though many species either die out after a few years or die off in harsh weather. This page lists the bird species that have established colonies in the [[British Isles]]. Some non-native birds have established themselves and become naturalised after naturally migrating to the country and forming colonies, such as the [[collared dove]].
Escaped birds of certain species, e.g. [[ruddy shelduck]], can cause confusion amongst birdwatchers as they occasionally occur in Britain as wild birds.
The following species have established colonies in the UK at some point in time. They may have since died out, or new colonies established elsewhere. [[Image:Rose-ringed Parakeet, Karkala, Karnataka, India.jpg|thumb|right|Ring-necked parakeets are now very numerous in places such as the home counties.]] * [[Black-crowned night heron]]: Since 1951, a free flying colony of the American race has existed at [[Edinburgh Zoo]], Scotland, although the zoo now has a policy of not releasing free winged birds. There is also a similar colony at Great Witchingham, [[Norfolk]]. * [[Black swan]]: One of the commonest of escaped waterfowl, individual birds/pairs can be encountered on almost any body of water and several pairs breed annually, though so far no permanent colonies have become established. * [[White-fronted goose]]: Wild birds do not breed in the UK. A small breeding population on [[Islay]] in Scotland stems from a wildfowl collection; feral birds may be encountered occasionally amongst flocks of other geese. * [[Domestic goose]]: Common farmyard escapee. Can be encountered anywhere, and breeds readily with the [[greylag goose]], as the former is a subspecies of the latter. * [[Bar-headed goose]]: Can be seen in scattered localities, though is not yet a regular breeder. * [[Snow goose]]: Appears as a wild bird in Scotland annually, those seen in summer are escapes. A small population moves between the islands of [[Coll]] and [[Isle of Mull|Mull]] in the Scottish [[Inner Hebrides]]. There are also scattered birds elsewhere. * [[Emperor goose]]: An occasional escapee which may be encountered amongst flocks of feral geese, but they have bred at [[Walney Island]] and in [[Essex]]. * [[Swan goose]]: The domesticated version of this bird, commonly known as the Chinese goose, is a common farmyard escapee and can be found on small ponds throughout the country. "True" swan goose is an infrequent escape, individuals or small parties may occasionally be encountered within feral flocks of [[Canada geese]] etc. * [[Canada goose]]: First introduced in the 17th century, this bird has now spread throughout the country and is abundant throughout its range. Large flocks, often numbering several hundred birds, are a feature of many man-made waterways where truly "wild" geese are generally absent. * [[Barnacle goose]]: A population of feral birds now exists in southern England, with strong populations in [[East Anglia]], [[Humberside]], [[Bedfordshire]], [[Gloucestershire]] and [[Hampshire]]. These birds are largely resident (wild barnacle geese are winter visitors to parts of Scotland and Ireland) and breeding is frequent. Away from these strongholds, individual feral and escaped birds often join flocks of their far more abundant relative, the [[Canada goose]] * [[Egyptian goose]]: A population was first introduced in the 17th century, and historically, free-flying flocks were established on private estates in North [[Norfolk]], [[Devon]], [[Bedfordshire]] and [[East Lothian]]. They are now common in [[Norfolk]] and have spread west, as far as [[Rutland Water]]<ref>W. J. Sutherland & G. Allport (2009) The distribution and ecology of naturalized Egyptian Geese Alopochen aegyptiacus in Britain, Bird Study, 38:2, 128-134, DOI: 10.1080/00063659109477080</ref>. * [[Ruddy shelduck]]: Birds are widely reported from all across Britain, especially [[Norfolk]] and south-western England, although confirmed breeding is unusual. Wild ruddy shelducks certainly occurred in Britain during the 19th century and early 20th century and some records, especially in late summer, may still refer to genuine vagrants from breeding areas in southern & south-eastern [[Europe]] and [[North Africa]] (or wanderers from feral colonies across the [[North Sea]]) * [[Muscovy duck]]: A common escapee, frequent on town park lakes or anywhere ducks gather to be fed by humans, breeding pairs can be found on scattered waterways all across the country; a well-established colony exists in [[Cambridgeshire]]. These birds are of the [[Domestic muscovy duck|domesticated form]], differing from the wild South American Muscovy by showing varying amounts of white in their otherwise black plumage. * [[Domesticated duck]]: The quintessential "farmyard duck" and domesticated form of the [[Mallard]], examples in varying plumages can be found on almost any [[Urban area|urban]] waterway. They will breed readily with genuinely wild mallards (in scientific terms, they are the same [[species]] and ultimately revert to the standard colouration). * [[Wood duck|Wood or Carolina duck]]: A small population formerly existed in [[Bedfordshire]], it has now declined. In addition can be found breeding at other favoured sites in southern England, though individual escaped/feral birds are more frequent. Is also a potential vagrant from North America; care should be taken especially with birds sighted in south-western England and Ireland * [[Mandarin duck]]: This Eastern Asian species was introduced as an ornamental bird, with escapes and deliberate releases resulting in a large and expanding population. Most numerous in the [[Home Counties]] but can also be found around [[Norfolk]], [[Rutland Water]], the [[River Severn]], and southern Scotland. * [[Ruddy duck]]: Introduced to [[Gloucestershire]] in the 1950s as a result of escapees from [[WWT Slimbridge|Slimbridge Wildfowl Trust]], spread rapidly over central England, now subject to eradication program due to the fact that it threatens the [[white-headed duck]] in [[Europe]]. * [[Red-crested pochard]]: A population has become established in scattered areas across southern England, with a well-established breeding colony in the [[Cotswold Water Park]], [[Gloucestershire]]/[[Wiltshire]]: * [[Bobwhite quail]]: Introduced as game bird to many areas; colonies became established in [[Suffolk]] and the [[Isles of Scilly]], now rarely reported. * [[Red-legged partridge]]: Introduced as a game bird in the 18th century, now common over much of England as far north as Scotland, and still regularly released for shooting. * [[Chukar partridge|Chukar]]: Introduced many times for shooting in the past, and regularly hybridised with red-legged partridge until releases of both chukars and hybrids were banned in 1992. Now very rare if not extinct. * [[Reeves's pheasant]]: Introduced in the 19th century to [[Bedfordshire]] and [[Inverness-shire]], but birds later died out, released for shooting up to the present day, and individuals may be found by chance all over the UK. Has been especially frequently reported in [[Norfolk]] over recent years. * [[Silver pheasant]]: Introduced several times for use as a game bird and for ornament, but failed to naturalise. Reported occasionally. * [[Green pheasant]]: Introduced for game shooting purposes, readily hybridises with common pheasant. Releases continue to this day and breeding has been speculated upon, though not proven, in [[Norfolk]] * [[Common pheasant]]: First introduced as long ago as Roman times, now abundant all over apart from in cities and on the highest ground. Many millions released each year for shooting. * [[Golden pheasant]]: Introduced to many areas for ornament and as a game bird. Can be encountered anywhere, but is declining as a breeding bird; stronghold remains the [[Breckland]] of [[Norfolk]], with populations persisting on [[Anglesey]], in [[Dumfries and Galloway]] and on [[Brownsea Island]], [[Dorset]] [[Image:Goldenpheasant04.jpg|thumb|right|Golden pheasant are one of many game birds introduced for sport and ornamental purposes.]] * [[Lady Amherst's pheasant]]: Introduced for shooting and ornament, but now the small population is confined to Bedfordshire (and is all but extinct). May be found elsewhere from time to time. * [[Indian peafowl]]: Free ranging birds have escaped and bred on occasion, as has happened in [[Norfolk]], [[Nottinghamshire]] and [[Worcestershire]]. * [[Helmeted guineafowl]]: Birds may stray from farms into the surrounding countryside, and have bred on occasion. Others may just wander during the daytime, to return to the safety of the farm at night. * [[Rock dove|Feral pigeon]]: Descendants of escaped (and released) domesticated [[rock dove]]s—one of very few truly [[feral]] species. * [[Barbary dove]]: Cagebird escapes have bred, current status confused by the very similar [[collared dove]]. * [[Alexandrine parakeet]]: This bird, very similar to the ring-necked parakeet, is a frequent escape and has bred in the past. * [[Ring-necked parakeet]]: Introduced in the 1960s, now widespread in [[south-east England]] and flocks of several thousand gather to roost at sites in [[Kent]], [[Surrey]] and [[Greater London]]. A bird which has readily adapted to [[Urban area|urban]] [[garden]]s, being a frequent visitor to feeding stations, it is now spreading outside of its current range, being able to tolerate the cold winters of the British Isles. The British birds are sometimes refereed to as [[Kingston parakeets]]. * [[Blue-crowned parakeet]]: Escapees have bred in Southern England. * [[Monk parakeet]]: Several colonies have formed in recent years, notably in [[Hertfordshire]] and [[Surrey]]. * [[Budgerigar]]: Formerly several populations present, including a notable one on the [[Isles of Scilly]] which lasted many years. Now only likely to be encountered as an escapee, of which it is one of the most frequent. * [[Eurasian eagle owl]]: A famous pair have set up residence in [[North Yorkshire]], and have sparked large media interest. Their status is unknown, as to whether they are escapees or wild birds; other reports, similarly of unknown origin, are occasionally received from wide-ranging localities. * [[Little owl]]: First recorded in 1842 in Yorkshire, it is now well established throughout England and Wales.[http://www.nonnativespecies.org/factsheet/factsheet.cfm?speciesId=399] * [[Red-winged laughingthrush]]: One escaped pair of this curious bird have apparently bred on the [[Isle of Man]]. * [[Yellow-fronted canary]]: Cage bird escapes on occasion, though they often do not last long in our climate. * [[Domestic canary]]: Escapes have survived for some time in the wild, though they are not thought to have bred. * [[Waxbill|Common waxbill]]: Cagebird escapes of several species from time to time. * [[Zebra finch]]: This bird is extremely common in aviculture, and is a very productive breeder. Small colonies may set up from time to time after a multiple escape, but they rarely last long.
In addition to the species listed below, almost any bird kept in captivity (especially wildfowl) may escape and their origins may not always be obvious. Excluding the likelihood of captive origin is a major hurdle to be faced by the [[British Birds Rarities Committee]] when assessing reports of rare and vagrant species to Britain.
==See also== *[[List of introduced bird species]] *[[Invasive species in the British Isles]]
==References== <references />
==External links== * [http://www.rbbp.org.uk/RBBP%20NN%20Report%202001.pdf RBBP Non-native birds report 2001] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070928044817/http://www.rbbp.org.uk/RBBP%20NN%20Report%202002.pdf RBBP Non-native birds report 2002] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070129000047/http://www.wwt.org.uk/research/monitoring/non-native.asp WWT Non-native Wildfowl] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110720075220/http://www.bou.org.uk/recbrlst3.html#Category%20E#Category%20E BOU Official British List; Category E (known or presumed escaped birds recorded in Britain]

[[File:Grand Coat of arms of Vilnius.svg|140px|right|Coat of Arms of Vilnius]] The following is a '''list of notable people from Lithuania's capital city of [[Vilnius]] (historically known by the names of Vilna/Wilna/Wilno)'''. It includes both the people born there and people born elsewhere but otherwise connected to it. {{Compact ToC}}
==A== * [[Neringa Aidietytė]] (b. 1983), athlete<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iaaf.org/athletes/biographies/letter=0/athcode=200703/index.html|title=IAAF: Neringa Aidietyte - Profile|website=iaaf.org|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Frantsishak Alyakhnovich]] (1883–1944), Belarusian playwright and journalist * [[Algirdas]] (1296–1377), Grand Duke of Lithuania * [[Ana Ambrazienė]] (b. 1955), hurdler, former world record holder<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iaaf.org/athletes/biographies/letter=0/athcode=60045/index.html|title=IAAF: Anna Ambraziene - Profile|website=iaaf.org|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Michał Elwiro Andriolli]] (1836–1893), Polish-Lithuanian painter and architect of Italian descent * [[Irena Andriukaitienė]] (b. 1948), politician and signature of the [[Act of the Re-Establishment of the State of Lithuania]] * [[Mark Antokolsky]] (1843–1902), Russian-Jewish sculptor * [[Laura Asadauskaitė]] (b. 1984), modern pentathlon athlete<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/as/laura-asadauskaite-1.html|title=Laura Asadauskaitė Bio, Stats, and Results|website=Olympics at Sports-Reference.com|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref>
==B== * [[Francišak Bahuševič]] (1840–1900), Belarusian poet * [[Živilė Balčiūnaitė]] (b. 1979), long-distance runner, European champion * [[Aidas Bareikis]] (b. 1967), artist<ref>{{cite web|url=http://the-artists.org/artist/Aidas-Bareikis|title=Bareikis, Aidas - the-artists.org|website=the-artists.org|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Liutauras Barila]] (b. 1974), Olympic biathlete<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/ba/liutauras-barila-1.html|title=Liutauras Barila Bio, Stats, and Results|website=Olympics at Sports-Reference.com|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Jonas Basanavičius]] (1851–1927), leader of Lithuania's national revival movement * [[Ričardas Berankis]] (b. 1990), the top ranked Lithuanian tennis player of all time<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.atpworldtour.com/Tennis/Players/Be/R/Richard-Berankis.aspx|title=Players - ATP World Tour - Tennis|website=atpworldtour.com|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Alexander Berkman]] (1870–1936), leading member of the anarchist movement in the early 20th century * [[Mykolas Biržiška]] (1882–1962), historian of literature, politician, signer of the [[Act of Independence of Lithuania]] * [[Vaclovas Biržiška]] (1884–1956), publisher, historian * [[Eglė Bogdanienė]] (b. 1962), textile artist * [[Kazys Bradūnas]] (1917–2009), poet * [[Algirdas Brazauskas]] (1932–2010), Lithuanian President and Prime Minister * [[Danutė Budreikaitė]] (b. 1953), politician and Member of the European Parliament * [[Teodor Bujnicki]] (1907–1944), Polish poet
==C== * [[Saint Casimir]] (1458–1484), patron saint of Poland and Lithuania * [[Dalius Čekuolis]] (b. 1959), politician * [[Jan Karol Chodkiewicz]] (1560–1621), politician and [[hetman]] * [[Leonard Cohen]] (1934–2016), Canadian singer-songwriter, poet and novelist; his mother Masha Cohen and maternal grandfather Rabbi Solomon Klinitsky-Klein were from the area of Wilno{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} * [[César Cui]] (1835–1918), Russian composer and music critic of French, Polish and Lithuanian descent * [[Yitzhak Zuckerman]] (1915–1981), one of the leaders of the [[Warsaw Ghetto Uprising]]
==D== * [[Ingeborga Dapkūnaitė]] (b. 1963), actress * [[Simonas Daukantas]] (1793–1864), historian * [[Mikalojus Daukša]] (1527–1613), publisher of the first printed [[Lithuanian language|Lithuanian]] book in GDL * [[Gintaras Didžiokas]] (b. 1966), politician * [[Ignacy Domeyko]] (1802–1889), geologist and engineer * [[Raminta Dvariškytė]] (b. 1990), Olympic swimmer<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/dv/raminta-dvariskyte-1.html|title=Raminta Dvariškytė Bio, Stats, and Results|website=Olympics at Sports-Reference.com|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Felix Dzerzhinsky]] (1877–1926), founder of the Soviet secret police * [[Audrius Dzikaras]] (b. 1957), painter ==F== *[[Yechezkel Feivel]] (1755–1833), [[Maggid]]
==G== * [[Romain Gary]] (1914–1980), French writer * [[Martynas Gecevičius]] (b. 1988), basketball player * [[Gediminas]] ({{circa|1275}}–1341), Grand Duke of Lithuania, founder of Vilnius city * [[Petras Geniušas]] (b. 1961), classical pianist * [[Marija Gimbutas]] (1921–1994), archeologist * [[Rolandas Gimbutis]] (b. 1981), swimmer<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/gi/rolandas-gimbutis-1.html|title=Rolandas Gimbutis Bio, Stats, and Results|website=Olympics at Sports-Reference.com|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Liudas Gira]] (1884–1946), poet, writer, and literary critic * [[Johann Christoph Glaubitz]] ({{circa|1700}}–1767), architect * [[Kęstutis Glaveckas]] (b. 1949), politician and signature of the [[Act of the Re-Establishment of the State of Lithuania]] * [[Antoni Gorecki]] (1787–1861), writer, poet, soldier * [[Albertas Goštautas]] ({{circa|1480}}–1539), Chancellor of Grand Duchy of Lithuania * [[Mindaugas Griškonis]] (b. 1986), Olympic rower<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/gr/mindaugas-griskonis-1.html|title=Mindaugas Griškonis Bio, Stats, and Results|website=Olympics at Sports-Reference.com|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Hubertas Grušnys]] (1961–2006), media proprietor, in 1989 launched the first-ever private radio station in Lithuania and the post-communist Eastern Europe * [[Dalia Grybauskaitė]] (b. 1956), President of Lithuania * [[Laurynas Gucevičius]] (1753–1798), architect * [[Daina Gudzinevičiūtė]] (b. 1965), shooter, Olympic gold medalist<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/gu/daina-gudzineviciute-1.html|title=Daina Gudzinevičiūtė Bio, Stats, and Results|website=Olympics at Sports-Reference.com|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref>

==L== * [[Vytautas Landsbergis]] (b. 1932), politician, contributed to the demise of the Soviet Union * [[Joachim Lelewel]] (1786–1861), Polish historian * [[Romas Lileikis]] (b. 1959), poet, musician, film director * [[Michalo Lituanus]], publicist, humanist of the 16th century * [[Eduard Lobau]] (b. 1988), Belarusian activist with the [[Belarusian democracy movement|nation's democracy movement]] * [[Józef Łukaszewicz]] (1863–1928), Polish physicist, geologist and mineralogist * [[Meilė Lukšienė]] (1913–2009), cultural historian and activist
==M== * [[Józef Mackiewicz]] (1902–1985), Polish writer * [[Andrius Mamontovas]] (b. 1967), singer * [[Gritė Maruškevičiūtė]] (b. 1989), Miss Lithuania 2010<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alfa.lt/straipsnis/10405403/?Mis.Lietuva.2010.tapo.vilniete.Grite.Maruskeviciute=2010-08-27_21-23|title=„Mis Lietuva 2010“ tapo vilnietė Gritė Maruškevičiūtė|website=alfa.lt|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Raimundas Mažuolis]] (b. 1972), swimmer, olympic medalist * [[Adam Mickiewicz]] (1798–1855), Polish poet * [[Jeronimas Milius]] (b. 1984), singer<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eurovision.tv/event/artistdetail?song=24520&event=1470|title=Eurovision Song Contest|website=www.eurovision.tv|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Czesław Miłosz]] (1911–2004), Polish poet, [[Nobel prize]] in Literature * [[Lazar Solomonovich Minor|Lazar Minor]] (1855–1942), Russian neurologist * [[Vytautas Miškinis]] (b. 1954), music composer and professor * [[Gediminas Motuza]] (b. 1946), geologist and author of geology textbooks

==R== * [[Antoni Radziwiłł]] (1775–1833), Polish and Prussian noble, aristocrat, musician and politician * [[Barbara Radziwiłł]] (Barbora Radvilaitė) (1520–1551), Queen of Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth * [[Clara Rockmore]] (1911–1998), classical [[violin]] [[Child prodigy|prodigy]] and a [[virtuoso]] performer of the [[theremin]] * [[Michał Pius Römer]] (1880–1945), rector of [[Vytautas Magnus University]], lawyer * [[Michał Józef Römer]] (1778–1853), writer and politician * [[Audrius Rudys]] (b. 1951), economist, politician and signature of the [[Act of the Re-Establishment of the State of Lithuania]] * [[Ferdynand Ruszczyc]] (1870–1936), painter
==S== * [[Lew Sapieha]] (1557–1633), politician and military commander * [[Maciej Kazimierz Sarbiewski]] (1595–1640), poet * [[Šarūnas Sauka]] (b. 1958), postmodern painter * [[Andrew Schally]] (b. 1926), Polish-American endocrinologist and Nobel Prize laureate * [[Žydrūnas Savickas]] (b. 1975), Strongman champion * [[Lasar Segall]] (1891–1957), Brazilian Jewish painter, engraver and sculptor * [[Kazimierz Siemienowicz]] (ca 1600 – ca 1651), military commander, engineer, theorist of artillery and pioneer of [[rocket]]ry * [[Konstantinas Sirvydas]] (1579–1631), lexicographer, writer * [[Piotr Skarga]] (1536–1612), theologian, writer and the first rector of the Wilno Academy * [[Francysk Skaryna]] (ca. 1490–1552), publisher, regarded as a publisher of first printed [[Ruthenian language|Ruthenian]] (sometimes credited as Old Belarusian) [[Bible]] * [[Boris Skossyreff]] (1896–1989), King of [[Andorra]] * [[Mykolas Sleževičius]] (1882–1939), lawyer, Prime Minister of Lithuania * [[Juliusz Słowacki]] (1809–1849), Polish poet * [[Antanas Smetona]] (1874–1944), publicist, President of [[Lithuania]]n Republic * [[Vilna Gaon|Elijah ben Solomon]], ''Gaon mi Vilna'' (1720–1797), [[Jews|Jewish]] scholar and [[Kabbalist]] * [[Jędrzej Śniadecki]] (1768–1838), chemist, biologist and philosopher * [[Audrius Stonys]] (b. 1966), renowned documentary filmmaker * [[Vytautas Straižys]] (b. 1936), astronomer, developer of [[Vilnius photometric system]] * [[Władysław Syrokomla]] (1823–1862), Polish poet, writer and translator * [[Deividas Šemberas]] (b. 1978), football player * [[Algirdas Šemeta]] (b. 1962), economist and the European Commissioner for Taxation and Customs Union, Audit and Anti-Fraud * [[Stasys Šilingas]] (1885–1962), lawyer and statesman, a significant figure in the history of Lithuania's independence * [[Tadas Šuškevičius]] (b. 1985), athlete

==Z== * [[Ludwik Zamenhof]] (1859–1917), philologist, creator of Esperanto * [[Tomasz Zan]] (1796–1855), poet * [[Aleksander Zawadzki (activist)|Aleksander Zawadzki]] (1859-1926), political and educational activist <ref>{{cite web|url=https://encyklopedia.pwn.pl/haslo/;4000645|title=Zawadzki Aleksander - Encyklopedia PWN - źródło wiarygodnej i rzetelnej wiedzy|website=encyklopedia.pwn.pl|accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref> * [[Artūras Zuokas]] (born 1968), mayor of Vilnius city municipality (2000–2007 and 2011–2015), Lithuanian politician * [[Robertas Žulpa]] (born 1960), swimmer, Olympic champion
